subject: Upset Sunday
event:
Two big upsets in today's NFL action.  The football pundits proved to be as wrong about today's winners as the political pundits were about New Hampshire.

The Giants and Cowboys played a nailbiter, and of course I was thrilled that the G-Men won and will be going on to the NFC Championship Game in Green Bay.  Packers against Giants, that's real Old School NFL.  Somewhere Vince Lombardi is smiling.

All the same, I'm going to forego my usual "life is magical and full of joy" tag line.  There's no a lot of joy around our house just now.  Gus is home, and still fighting gamely, but remains very sick.  It's really hard to care much about anything else.

comments.article: Best wishes to Gus for a full and speedy recovery.

My heart goes out to you and Paris over Gus. Not a lot of people realize how much a pet can become family and I just suffered a loss of my best friend last year who was also an 11 year old cat. She was my kid and my best friend in truth. I'm rooting for Gus and for happier news for you soon. *zen hug*

comments.upictitle: move along, nothing to see here.: splendor
comments.article: Austin has been effectively SHUT DOWN due to the Dallas loss. O___o

Sorry to hear about Gus... fingers crossed, eh?

As for today, well, I'm thrilled. I've been pulling for a Greenbay-NYG semi-final or whatever its called over here. I'd love to see Greenbay go all the way, especially to play the Pats in the final and beat them! But yes, to see the Colts and the Cowboys go out made me very happy =)

Well, even if things ain't so pretty now, here's hopin they will be soon, and all the well-wishes here will keep for a sunny day.

First off, all the best for Gus. If he's lasted eleven years with a guy from Jersey, he's gotta be a tough old Codger.

Second off, big props on the Giants. I seriously think that playing the Pats hard in week 17 changed their whole team. Eli seems to have shaken the jitters for good. Main thing, though, is that they seem to own the best pass rush in the NFL, which is probably the only thing that can disrupt the Patriots' offense. With the way they're playing now, wouldn't be surprised to see a rematch.

Course, they win in Lambeau in January first, so best not to count chickens. . .
comments.subject: That's what blogs are for

comments.article:
From Blade Runner:

“I’ve seen things you people wouldn’t believe. Attack ships on fire off the shoulder of Orion. I watched C-beams glitter in the darkness at Tannhäuser Gate. All those moments will be lost in time like tears in rain...time to die...”

–Gatty

“I don’t know why he saved my life.

Maybe in those last moments he loved life more than he ever had before. Not just his life, anybody’s life, my life.

All he’d wanted were the same answers the rest of us want. Where did I come from? Where am I going? How long have I got?

All I could do was sit there and watch him die.”

–Decker

And from Titanic:

“I don’t even have a picture of him. He exists now…only in my memory.”

–Rose
comments.subject: It hurts...

comments.article: Now now. Now need for such morbib thoughts. Gus is home, at least for the time being, & still very much fighting.
comments.subject: Re: It hurts...

comments.article:
Sorry for your cat's troubles. One of my cats is about 14 and I can tell he's struggling.

Hard to get excited about football, or any sport for that matter, when a member of the family (pets included) is struggling.

As for the games, I only really got to see the Giants win. Pretty solid victory, although Dallas sort of helped them out by sucking in the second half. Never heard of a guy having 'trouble' with snapping the ball.

Good luck to all. Here's to hoping for an entertaining rest of the playoffs.

yah congrats, Any idea what book you are gonna get him to read?

I suggest "Watch on the Rhine" by by John Ringo & Tom Kratman

or "End of an Era" by Tom J Sawyer

Best wishes and muchest sympathy for Gus and all of you; sorry not to have said this before now but have been behind on lj reading of late. Our dog Zoe has been battling osteosarcoma in her back leg for months (and thanks to the wonderfully competent vet, a broken leg since they x-rayed her, which is proving to be more problematic than the cancer, since apparently no one is willing to attempt treating broken legs in which there is bone cancer, even when the leg begins to swell horribly, as hers has over the last couple of weeks--they tell us it is only soft tissue swelling and no danger in itself, at least, tho at this point amputation is looking like the best option).

Anyway, for what it's worth, even if they give you a poor prognosis for your cat, he may defy them as well as Zoe has--they initially told us the cancer would kill her within a two weeks at most, probably within 10 days, w/out immediate amputation (2-4 months was the prognosis *with* amputation, and she's already well into that range), and thus far, she is doing fine other than the swelling from the leg break.

On a more trivial note, congratulations on the Giants winning. =)

(and thanks to the wonderfully competent vet, a broken leg since they x-rayed her, which is proving to be more problematic than the cancer, since apparently no one is willing to attempt treating broken legs in which there is bone cancer, even when the leg begins to swell horribly, as hers has over the last couple of weeks--they tell us it is only soft tissue swelling and no danger in itself, at least, tho at this point amputation is looking like the best option)


Christ! I tell you, some vets should be shot to the moon. It's a tragedy how many animals are being fucked up by those who are supposed to heal them. When my 14-year-old cat got diagnosed with chronic renal failure in an early stage last July the vet's treatment almost killed him. No need to say this vet is history for us. *sigh*

Congratulations! I hope everyone is taking back some of the stuff they said about Eli earlier in the season but I doubt it.

Sorry to hear that Gus is still so sick. I know y'all were hopeful about the treatments in Albuquerque. Thinking of all of you.

Despite the crushing blow that was my Cowboys losing the game and ending their season today, I have to give the Giants credit for a playoff performance that so amazingly outshines the team we played early in the season. Next weekend should be an interesting match-up.

Sorry to hear Gus is still sick, best wishes for a full recovery.

Hooray for the Gints!

Unfortunately this means that we get to keep Eli and Coughlin. Eli once again showed that if his family isn't around and he's on the road and the weather is nice he can not screw up. Too bad we can't hope for warm weather in Green Bay. And, Coughlin showed us he can't manage the clock at the end of a game.

I know folks are giddy with the latest victory. If the 'Boys hadn't all put hand lotion on in the second half the game would not have been close. That 20 play drive, obviously took the starch out of their big, heavy linemen. 2 1/2 weeks off generally isn't good for fat athletes.

All said I'll still be rooting for the Giants and praying for warm weather or maybe very windy weather might be better.

mew meow purrr...

I think the Giants will be fine if it's simply cold weather. It's the potential for snow or heavy winds that scare me. Eli doesn't react well to either.

With clear skys I give the Jints a 50-50 shot. If it's snowing, windy or rainy, I think they'll be mangled.
Pulling for Gus...

I'd love to see the G-Men whoop the Pats. Pack first, natch, but it won't be nearly as satisfying.   Sorry about your Gus.  If you've never seen this it can be oddly amusing to Jet fans.  Giant fans as well (or anyone else who follows the trials and tribulations of Gang-green).  <http://youtube.com/watch?v=rzxnefluy98>
comments.subject: Go Big Blue!

comments.article: whoops- to watch the vid you may need to click and past the link on to youtube's search function.
comments.subject: Re: Go Big Blue!

comments.upictitle: A Very Friendly Asshole: NEVER FORGET
comments.article: GO CHARGERS!!

comments.upictitle: A Very Friendly Asshole: NEVER FORGET
comments.article: Ok, ok, I'm not quite an ALL CAPS FAN, but I got excited today :)

So sorry to hear about your cat. I have a seventeen-year-old cat myself, and even though she has no pressing illnesses, I am trying to mentally reconcile with the knowledge that she won't be around much longer. I can only imagine what you are going through, since Gus's situation sounds so much more dire.

Best of wishes to him, and you.

Hey. I've only ever lurked on your LJ, before. I wanted to give you best wishes for Gus, though. I hope he gets better, soon, but either way... they know. They know when they're loved, and cared for, and rooted for, and I'm sure he does, and I'm sure that makes a difference.
My best wishes to Gus: as long as there is fight left in him, there's still hope. And I hope they found out what it is that's ailing him, since nothing's worse than not knowing what's wrong.

My heart goes out to you. My cat is also very sick right now, and he's pretty much my best friend, so I can only imagine how you're feeling.

I'll keep Gus in my thoughts, and I know everyone else will too =/ Good luck!

All the best wishes for Gus and his human family. I lost my one cat in June last year to FIP at age 7 and my other furry kid has severe kidney problems. It's crazy how much love we have for our animal companions.

I found great help in online communities where the owners of sick cats share info and very competent advice on how to treat them. Maybe one of these groups could give you support in addition to the vet.

All week long, I listened to both radio and television morons prognosticate about how the Colts were going to destroy the Chargers.  To quote Dr.Z of Sports Illustrated:" I see a blowout here...Colts 38, Chargers 17." Don't think so.  Quoting Bob Kravitz of the Indianapolis Star:" The Chargers are going to be in over their heads." Not so much.  Yeah, yeah I know we still have to go to New England and play an even better team, but this is not the same team that the Pats beat up back in September. This game is not going to be a blowout either, the Patriots are great, but they can be beat.
comments.subject: Experts don't know $%#&

comments.article:
Still thinking good thought for Gus here.

Grats on your Giants too.

I can't express how happy I am that NY beat Dallas. Now Favre will not have to go down to that accursed Texas Stadium in Irvine. GB is better than Dallas but that place gives Favre the heeby-jeebies. I don't expect NY to be a push-over, but I don't see how the Giants will be able to beat a superior GB team in Lambeau. The Giants are good, and playing very well, but this is a match-up made in heaven for the Packers. My prediction:

GB 31
NY 17

Bring on Tom Brady!
comments.subject: Horay, Giants!!!!!

comments.article: If Favre and Brady matchup in the Superbowl, that'll be pretty awesome.  Two of the games best quarterbacks of all time.  I hope that works out.  Even though I am from MA, I don't know if I'll be rooting for NE though.  Yeah, it'd be cool to see a perfect season but it might be a little more thrilling to see a 38yo Brett Favre beat this juggernaut which is the New England Patriots.
comments.subject: Re: Horay, Giants!!!!!

comments.article: Best Wishes and Positive thoughts coming your way for Gus, yourself and Paris from KY.
Godspeed to Gus. Pets... you can't help but love them.

Hang in there Gus! Poor little guy.

Congrats to the G-Men for really stepping up, especially the last half with all the pressure they applied on Romo. I can't help but be disappointed in the way Dallas played there, but I know they played their guts out and for them it's even worse that it must be for us that are merely spectators.

Watching Indy and the Jags lose was a bummer. It looks like one more chance to stop the Pats next week, I don't think the Chargers are up to it, but like they say...any given Sunday and it's the playoffs. If they can take it to the defense like they did Indy's that last quarter they just might pull off an upset to really remember!
